meanings.definition: The state or quality of being alien or foreign.
meanings.sent1: The aliennesses of the new student made them stand out in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The aliennesses of the exotic fruit puzzled the local farmers.
meanings.sent3: The aliennesses of the talking parrot entertained the children at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The aliennesses of the glowing mushrooms in the forest felt like a scene from a sci-fi movie.
meanings.sent5: The aliennesses of the ancient artifact captured the archaeologists' attention.

meanings.definition: The condition of being different or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: The aliennesses of the new technology left many people confused.
meanings.sent2: The aliennesses of the foreign language made it challenging to communicate.
meanings.sent3: The aliennesses of the unusual painting sparked a lively debate among the art critics.
meanings.sent4: The aliennesses of the distant planet fascinated the astronomers studying it.
meanings.sent5: The aliennesses of the mysterious creature in the lake intrigued the local residents.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being strange or otherworldly.
meanings.sent1: The aliennesses of the haunted house gave it a spooky reputation.
meanings.sent2: The aliennesses of the ghostly figure sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent3: The aliennesses of the glowing jellyfish in the dark ocean waters mesmerized the divers.
meanings.sent4: The aliennesses of the eerie fog enveloped the town in an unsettling atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The aliennesses of the mysterious sound in the forest kept the campers on edge.
